translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Great Chapter
The Elder Suvaṇṇapuppha
“The Fortunate One named Vipassī,
the world’s chief, the bull of a man,
was sitting in the midst of the people,
teaching the deathless state.
Having heard the Dhamma
of the one with two feet, the most excellent,
I offered four golden flowers
to the Buddha.
The whole assembly was covered in gold,
and the Buddha’s radiance and the golden radiance

analyzed: ālokaḥ vipulaḥ  udagga cittaḥ sumanaḥ  veda jātaḥ katañjalī
translated: were a vast light.🔽With a mind uplifted and gladdened,
with knowledge born, with hands together in respectful salutation,🔽I was the one who brought them joy,
the one who brought happiness in the present life.
Having requested the Buddha,
and worshipped the one with good feet,
having generated joy,
I went to my own home.

analyzed: bhavane upaviṭṭhaḥ uha  buddha seṭṭham  tena citta ppasādena
translated: Having sat down in my home,🔽I recollected the best Buddha,🔽and through that faith in my mind
I was reborn in the Tusita heaven.
For ninety-one eons🔽I offered flowers,
and I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
Sixteen kings,
all with the name of Nemis,
in thirty-four of these cycles,
were Universal Monarchs of great strength.
The four analytical knowledges,
The Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā suvaṇṇapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Suvaṇṇapupphiyattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā suvaṇṇapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽suvaṇṇapupphiya therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: Thus have I heard: this was said by the Elder Suvannapup-phiya.🔽The Story of the Elder Suvannapup-phiya is the fifth.
